Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 12:21PM runnergirl4life wrote: Hello everyone, I had a lumpectomy two weeks ago today. Is it normal to have considerable swelling? Yesterday I didn't do much moving around and it went down considerably, but it still looks like I've had a breast augmentation of at least one size up. It is pretty uncomfortable and is still hard to sleep if I'm not totally exhausted. Thanks for your help! Renee'
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy~ ur experience Deanna67 Deanna67

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 01:18PM runnergirl4life wrote: Hi Claire, I didn't have a drain. I have a pretty good sized inicision as the lump with scar tissue was pretty good sized. Had my post op appointment this past Monday and the surgeon was a little suprised about the amount of bruising and swelling, but didn't think it was something to be concerned about. I wasn't given any instruction at the hospital to treat for swelling, so didn't think much about it til now. I can email or call my surgeon (we are covered by Kaiser). But, will be going to my radiation and chemo consultations tomorrow so can always ask them then. I'm thinking I need to go shopping for looser shirts and sweaters to wear this winter so I'm not stuck in sweatshirts for 3 months. :) Thanks for your input. Renee'
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy~ ur experience Deanna67 Deanna67

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2010 01:20PM runnergirl4life wrote: Deanna, Please give update as to how you are doing. :) Renee'

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2012 01:41AM runnergirl4life wrote: Shera, I have white stripes across my nails. Right now there are two. I imagine one more will show up soon as I've had three infusions. One nail is splitting where the highest stripe is. So I think I will have to start wearing polish. I'm curious about anyone else's experience with nails this way. What happens when the stripes grow out?
